result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brandon V Bremer

records.addlTxt: Def's NOH for preliminary hearing 12-8 returned from DCJ.  Defendant no longer in-custody.

9:16 AM Prosecuting attorney Robin W Lee in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defn atty requested a setover and waived time limits in the letter. State does not obj to setover. Court granted setover. Commissioner approved setover in other case that was scheduled for this same date/time. Cases scheduled together.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for December 8, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing on December 8, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
from Atty Nicholson Goetz for setover of the 10/27/2022 preliminary hearing

Adjustment Number: 22A 051068,
Payable Number: 579967,
Receipt Number: 22RS046936,
Amount: $20.00
Referral to Dane County Pretrial Services (DCPS)

Cash bond is set in the amount of $10,000 (per case). If the defendant posts cash bail, the defendant must report to and comply with Pretrial Services. The defendant shall report to Pretrial Services by 10:00 A.M. on the business day following his/her release from jail. 
The following checked category(s) are also ordered: _x_ GPS, __ Remote Breath (Alcohol) Monitoring, and/or __ Random Drug Testing. 
NONCOMPLIANCE WILL BE REPORTED BY DCPS TO THE JUDICIARY WHO SHALL RESPOND IN ONE OF THESE WAYS: Schedule bail hearing, Increase Supervision, Issue warrant, No change but monitor. 
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Mercedez J or any child of Mercedez J. 
- Defendant shall not be at any residence of Mercedez J. 
- The Court finds substantial evidence that knowing and malicious prevention or dissuasion of the above victim(s) is reasonably likely to occur. The above conditions of release are hereby ordered pursuant to Sec. 940.47 and Chapter 969. 
Parties did not stipulate to waive the time limits for Preliminary Hearing.
Trial Judge - Br 17

1:30 PM Defendant Brandon V Bremer in court, in custody.  Attorney Nathan Tierney Otis in court for Brandon V Bremer.  Prosecuting attorney Benjamin Wagner in court for the State of Wisconsin. The defendant was advised regarding their right to an attorney and to the SPD application process if not already represented. Defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 27, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on October 27, 2022 at 09:30 am.
